qatestcase.subject: Date time value with various valid and invalid strings. valid strings first and then invalid
qatestcase.userStory: Increase SQL limits for formula fields + enhancements - Part 2

testcase.name: testFunctionRight
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: RIGHT() isn't in these dbs, and the SUBSTR version has very different semantics

testcase.name: testAddDateTimeMinutes
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Unknown issue with math and date_add

testcase.name: testIfNullNullIf
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: incorrectly converts null to text for number comparison

testcase.name: testDate
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: H2 corrects for gregorian calendar for old dates (1000)

testcase.name: testDateVarConstVar
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: H2 corrects for gregorian calendar for old dates (1000)

testcase.name: testDateVarVarConst
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: H2 corrects for gregorian calendar for old dates (1000)

testcase.name: testDateVarConstConst
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: H2 corrects for gregorian calendar for old dates (1000)

testcase.name: testIfORFunc
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: TODO: Google LastDay logic treats a null month as 0 and fails.

testcase.name: testExpSimple
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Spanner's jdbc decimal limit of 38 is absolute, not relative, so Exp(110) breaks

testcase.name: testExpUsesAbs
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Spanner's jdbc decimal limit of 38 is absolute, not relative, so Exp(110) breaks

testcase.name: testExpUsesCeil
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Spanner's jdbc decimal limit of 38 is absolute, not relative, so Exp(110) breaks

testcase.name: testExpUsesFloor
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Spanner's jdbc decimal limit of 38 is absolute, not relative, so Exp(110) breaks

testcase.name: testExpUsesSqrt
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Spanner's jdbc limit of 38 is absolute, not relative, so Exp(110) breaks

testcase.name: testExpUsesValue
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Spanner's jdbc decimal limit of 38 is absolute, not relative, so Exp(110) breaks

testcase.name: testDATEVALUEWithString
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: H2 corrects for gregorian calendar for old dates (1 CE)

testcase.name: testIfReturningNullForDateType
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: JDBC driver assumes NULL is Int64

testcase.name: testIfReturningNullForDateTimeType
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: JDBC driver assumes NULL is Int64

testcase.name: testLpad2
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: H2 does single char padding only

testcase.name: testRpad2
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: H2 does single char padding only

testcase.name: testSubtractTwoTimeFields
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Timediff is ABS, and subtime doesn't work in mariadb on time fields

testcase.name: testFormatCurrency
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Sqlite3 doesn't support group separators in decimals

testcase.name: testIfErrorDateTimeValueWithValidInValid
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: IfError not implemented correctly for Dates

testcase.name: testIfErrorTextTimeValueWithValidInValid
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: IfError not implemented correctly for Dates

testcase.name: testIfErrorBigDivide
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: IfError not implemented correctly for Google

testcase.name: testJsonValue
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: JsonValue requires a literal json path
H2 does not support json queries

testcase.name: testJsonPathValue
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: H2 does not support json queries

testcase.name: testMid
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Null start treated as zero with GREATEST.

testcase.name: testSubstr2
testcase.whyIgnoreJs: negative start greater than length works in js
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: negative start greater than length works.

testcase.name: testSubstr3
testcase.whyIgnoreJs: negative start greater than length works in js
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: negative start greater than length works.
negative start greater than length works.

testcase.name: testRegex
testcase.whyIgnoreJs: negative start greater than length works in js
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Sqlserver doesn't allow regexp in SQL
Oracle treats empty string like null, so regexp_like doesn't match ".*"

testcase.name: testLike
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: Invalid escape character with \s, difficult to validate
Sqlite is case sensitive without a global pragma

testcase.name: testIn2Text
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: ss vs compares the same with standard TransactSQL Hook

testcase.name: testIn2TextNull
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: ss vs compares the same with standard TransactSQL Hook

testcase.name: testIn2TextFoo
testcase.whyIgnoreSql: ss vs compares the same with standard TransactSQL Hook
